getColor

public static Color getColor(String attribute,
                             Color defaultColor)
Convert a color attribute string value to a java.awt.Color. The String is expected to consist of comma and/or space-separated integer numbers in the range 0 -> 255. For example the string "0, 255, 0" represents green. You can optionally specify a fourth value which represents a transparency value, for example "255,0,0,127" represents half-transparent red color.

Parameters:
attribute - the color string

setColor

public static String setColor(int red,
                              int green,
                              int blue,
                              int alpha)
convert color (red,green,blue,alpha) values to a String of the form "red,green,blue,alpha" or "red,green,blue" if the alpha value is exactly 255

getInteger

stringToDouble

public static double stringToDouble(String value,
                                    double defaultValue)
Converts a String to a double. A default value is passed in case a ParsingException occurs.

Parameters:
value - The String value to be converted.
defaultValue - The default value to use in case of parsing error.
Returns:
The double value for the given String.

replaceSeparators

public static String replaceSeparators(String coord)
Check coordinate and tuple separators in a coordinate definition string and replace them, if necessary.

Returns:
The coordinate definition string with right separators

Returns:
string that contains this notation
